column4: i plugged in my external hard driver, i can see it from "System:/media" and from "/media" but when i try to "cd /media"  i get root@bt:/media# cd part 2 yassine
bash: cd: part: No such file or direct
root@bt:/media# cd part 2 yassine
bash: cd: part: No such file or direct
i plugged in my external hard driver, i can see it from "System:/media" and from "/media" but when i try to "cd /media"  i get root@bt:/media# cd part 2 yassine
 bash: cd: part: No such file or direct
Did you try quoting the spaces?
: what do u mean?
Like "part\ 2\ yassine" instead of "part 2 yassine".
So is "part 2 yassine" one folder?
omg thx so much !
The "backslash trick" (quoting) works for all special characters (I think).
: lol space is a special character? :) thx u again
It interprets it as an argument separator.
Cd was seeing "Argument 1='part' Argument 2='2' Argument 3='yassine'". With the backslashes, it tells it that you want "Arugment 1='part 2 yassine'".
: ahh it make sense ..
Is that all or do you need more help?
:) thx u so much ^^
Glad I could help. BTW, I just learned about quoting last month...
: i just started linux 2days ^^
I see. I think you'll like it here though.
: hell yea ^^ and wth this IRC .. :D !
Also, ubottu can help you with some things too.
